meanings.definition: To prevent or protect against something
meanings.sent1: I will forfend any harm from reaching you.
meanings.sent2: She used a strong lock to forfend intruders.
meanings.sent3: The brave knight forfended the dragon's fiery breath with his shield.
meanings.sent4: The umbrella forfended the raindrops like a shield.
meanings.sent5: Forfend the danger with a sturdy barrier.

meanings.sent1: Forfend that such a tragedy should occur!
meanings.sent2: Forfend! I hope nothing bad happens.
meanings.sent3: Forfend we run out of ice cream before the party!
meanings.sent4: Forfend the storm disrupts our plans.
meanings.sent5: Forfend the thought of losing our way in the dark.
